content:
• Monday, June 10, 2013
  • CI

    Cigna (NYSE:CI) is expanding its relationship with pharmacy-benefit manager Catamaran...

    Cigna (NYSE:CI) is expanding its relationship with pharmacy-benefit manager Catamaran (NASDAQ:CTRX) through a new 10-year deal that CI says will combine strengthen the two companies' drug-purchasing scale and add to the insurers' earnings. The deal is a big win for CTRX, whose shares have been under pressure for months over concern that the company was about to lose the account. CTRX +14% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM
  • BHC

    More on Synergetics (OTCQB:SURG): FQ3 beats across the board as revenue jumped 11.6% Y/Y. OEM...

    More on Synergetics (OTCQB:SURG): FQ3 beats across the board as revenue jumped 11.6% Y/Y. OEM sales increased 24.1% Y/Y, while Ophthalmic sales increased 3.1% over the same period. Domestic sales rose 13.8% and International sales increased 5.3%. Shares +5.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:48 PM
  • NAV

    More on Navistar (NYSE:NAV): Q2 misses hard, with losses on a per share basis coming in much...

    More on Navistar (NYSE:NAV): Q2 misses hard, with losses on a per share basis coming in much greater than the prior year period and revenue also declining by 23% Y/Y. Net losses widened as the commercial-truck maker posted lower volumes and and higher pre-existing warranty adjustments, primarily related to EPA 2010 emissions level engines. Both its truck and engine units reported a wider losses, with the only bright spot coming from its parts segment, which saw income more than double as margins improved. Shares -1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:41 PM
  • DMND

    More on Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND): The company announces the appointment of Raymond P. Silcock...

    More on Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND): The company announces the appointment of Raymond P. Silcock as Executive Vice President and CFO, effective immediately. Mr. Silcock replaces Michael Murphy, who has served as Interim CFO since February, 2012. Shares +3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM
  • DMND

    More on Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND): FQ3 beats on both the top and bottom line, results CEO...

    More on Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND): FQ3 beats on both the top and bottom line, results CEO Brain Driscoll says are indicative of the progress made towards revitalizing the company. Snack revenues rise 1.6% while the nut segment posts a 23.2% drop in sales. Gross margin improves to 23.4% from 16.5%. DMND says "net sales are expected to decline more in the back half of the fiscal year than the first half as compared to the prior year." The company will file an amendment to its 10Q for the three month period ended January 31 to restate GAAP diluted EPS. Shares +5.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • KGC

    Kinross Gold (NYSE:KGC) -5% AH on news it will cease development of its Frutal del Norte project...

    Kinross Gold (NYSE:KGC) -5% AH on news it will cease development of its Frutal del Norte project in Ecuador after failing to reach agreement with the government on the country's mining and tax laws, resulting in a Q2 charge of ~$720M. KGC also extends the maturity dates of its $1.5B revolving credit facility and $1B term loan.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • BEAT

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: BEAT +36%. CTRX +14%. CYS +3%. KNDI +3%. GME +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: BEAT +36%. CTRX +14%. CYS +3%. KNDI +3%. GME +3%.
    After-hours top losers: LULU -11%. ASTX -6%. XTEX -4%. COCO -4%. PBY-OLD -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • COCO

    Corinthian Colleges (NASDAQ:COCO) discloses it received a subpoena from the SEC requesting...

    Corinthian Colleges (NASDAQ:COCO) discloses it received a subpoena from the SEC requesting documents and communications relating to student information and compliance with U.S. Department of Education financial requirements, standards and ratios. Shares -4.3% AH before being halted.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • BEAT

    CardioNet (NASDAQ:BEAT) inks a three-year National Provider Agreement with UnitedHealthcare...

    CardioNet (NASDAQ:BEAT) inks a three-year National Provider Agreement with UnitedHealthcare (NYSE:UNH), covering all of BEAT's monitoring modalities, including its Mobile Cardiac Outpatient Telemetry. The agreement is effective July 1, and applies to all UNH affiliated entities, including managed Medicare and managed Medicaid plans. Shares +34% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • BHC

    Synergetics (OTCQB:SURG): FQ3 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $16.3M (+11.6% Y/Y) beats...

    Synergetics (OTCQB:SURG): FQ3 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $16.3M (+11.6% Y/Y) beats by $1.31M. Shares +4.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • ENLK

    Crosstex Energy LP (XTEX) -4.3% AH after announcing a public offering of 6M common units....

    Crosstex Energy LP (XTEX) -4.3% AH after announcing a public offering of 6M common units. Proceeds will be used toward capital expenditures for currently identified projects, including the Cajun-Sibon natural gas liquids pipeline expansion, and for general partnership purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • BNNY

    More on Annie's (NYSE:BNNY) FQ4: Net sales, EBITDA, and EPS rise 21.5%, 33.6%, and 20.1%...

    More on Annie's (NYSE:BNNY) FQ4: Net sales, EBITDA, and EPS rise 21.5%, 33.6%, and 20.1% respectively as Q4 "capped off a successful year for [the] company," CEO John Foraker says. "Strong consumption trends" helped BNNY exceed company expectations for sales and "consumer interest in natural & organic foods continues to increase." For the full year, sales growth "was broad-based across channels" as net sales jump 21.1% from 2012. Outlook: For FY14, BNNY sees EPS of $0.97-1.01 versus consensus of $1.01. Shares -2.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • DVAX

    Dynavax (DVAX -43%) gets creamed today, dropping steadily from the open and hitting a new...

    Dynavax (DVAX -43%) gets creamed today, dropping steadily from the open and hitting a new 52-week low after the biopharm company reported that the FDA wants it to collect more saftety information from patients on Heplisav, its investigational adult hepatitis B vaccine.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • LULU

    Lululemon Athletica (NASDAQ:LULU): Q1 EPS of $0.32 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $345.8M (+21% Y/Y)...

    Lululemon Athletica (NASDAQ:LULU): Q1 EPS of $0.32 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $345.8M (+21% Y/Y) beats by $4.69M. Shares -10.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • LULU

    Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) CEO Christine Day will step down as soon as a successor is named, the...

    Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) CEO Christine Day will step down as soon as a successor is named, the company announces in tandem with its FQ1 report. Day: "Now is the right time to bring in a CEO who will drive the next phase of lululemons development and growth." Shares -10.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 5 Comments
  • NPTN

    NeoPhotonics (NPTN +5.2%) and Alliance Fiber (AFOP +4.2%) close up strongly after SA contributor...

    NeoPhotonics (NPTN +5.2%) and Alliance Fiber (AFOP +4.2%) close up strongly after SA contributor Inflection Point Investing argues the optical component vendors are plays on the 100G optical networking boom, while making a fresh bull case for Infinera (INFN +1.6%). IPI points out NeoPhotonics mentioned in May it's seeing strong 100G component sales, and that it "supplies to seemingly every big vendor in the optical space." Regarding Infinera, the firm is encouraged by Ciena's (CIEN +2.2%) earnings call remarks about "seeing a strong uptick" in 100G optical demand, with U.S. carriers leading the way. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • DXCM

    DexCom (DXCM -1.7%) slips after Wunderlich's Greg Simpson cut the shares from Buy to Hold on...

    DexCom (DXCM -1.7%) slips after Wunderlich's Greg Simpson cut the shares from Buy to Hold on valuation and removed the shares from its Best Ideas List. The firm says the stock is up 65% Y/Y, and, absent a takeover, near/intermediate-term upside on the shares is somewhat limited.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • EW

    There is a "better than average chance" Edwards Lifesciences (EW +3.5%) will prevail in a German...

    There is a "better than average chance" Edwards Lifesciences (EW +3.5%) will prevail in a German patent infringement case against Medtronic (MDT +0.1%), Canaccord (Buy) analyst Jason Mills says, adding that an injunction against MDT's CoreValue product "could propel" EW to $85/share. Separately, Credit Suisse upgrades EW to Outperform from Neutral.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • SIRI

    Shares of Sirius XM Radio (SIRI, LMCA) turn lower, now down 2.3%, as more details on the iTunes...

    Shares of Sirius XM Radio (SIRI, LMCA) turn lower, now down 2.3%, as more details on the iTunes radio are unveiled. The Apple service will be integrated into some new cars which could cut into subscriptions totals for Sirius.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM | 7 Comments
  • SLTM

    Solta Medical (SLTM +3.7%) pops after SA Pro contributor Stephen Simpson calls the aesthetics...

    Solta Medical (SLTM +3.7%) pops after SA Pro contributor Stephen Simpson calls the aesthetics company "a stealth play on better consumer confidence/disposable income" in an exclusive article published this morning. Beware though, while the shares could "make investors a pretty [penny]," they may "drive them most of the way to the asylum" in the interim.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • ELN

    Elan (ELN +1.5%) drops its lawsuit over Royalty Pharma's takeover after Royalty was was forced...

    Elan (ELN +1.5%) drops its lawsuit over Royalty Pharma's takeover after Royalty was was forced to revise its tender offer documents to provide significant amounts of additional information with the SEC late Friday afternoon.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • ANFI

    Amira Nature Foods (ANFI -8.9%) falls hard after reporting FQ4 and FY13 results that were...

    Amira Nature Foods (ANFI -8.9%) falls hard after reporting FQ4 and FY13 results that were essentially in line with expectations. In the report, the company says it expects FY14 revenue of $480-507M and EBITDA of $62-66M. Analysts are looking for sales of $491.04M in the coming year. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • WEN

    Hamburger stocks are making an unlikely run higher after McDonald's shows some solid improvement...

    Hamburger stocks are making an unlikely run higher after McDonald's shows some solid improvement with sales for May. Investors seem to be betting that the sector as a whole is in slightly better shape based on McDonald's performance and not that Mickey D's took market share from Wendy's (WEN +1.8%), Jack In The Box (JACK +0.9%), Sonic (SONC +1.7%), and Burger King Worldwide (BKW +1.8%) during the month.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • TWX

    Time Warner (TWX -2%) trades lower after Barron's Leslie Norton tees up the media company as a...

    Time Warner (TWX -2%) trades lower after Barron's Leslie Norton tees up the media company as a stock that could be trading ahead of itself. Though a pickup in ad spending looks likely, and the spinoff of Time Inc. could unfurl some value for TWX shareholders, the 64% 52-week runup looks a little overdone to Norton.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • PGNX

    Shares of Progenics (PGNX -7.8%) trade notably lower on the session. At the Annual Meeting of...

    Shares of Progenics (PGNX -7.8%) trade notably lower on the session. At the Annual Meeting of the Society of Nuclear Medicine and Molecular Imaging the company discussed findings from studies of two cancer product candidates added to its pipeline after the Molecular Insight Pharmaceuticals acquisition. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • NAT

    Nordic American Tankers (NAT +0.8%) ticks higher today, saying over the weekend that it's...

    Nordic American Tankers (NAT +0.8%) ticks higher today, saying over the weekend that it's cancelled its purchase of a suezmax tanker after the seller it said probably would not be ready for the agreed delivery date of June 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • GME

    Shares of GameStop (GME -2.7%) have traded increasingly skittish with the Apple Developer...

    Shares of GameStop (GME -2.7%) have traded increasingly skittish with the Apple Developer Conference ongoing and Microsoft releasing more details about its Xbox One.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • MPAA

    Motorcar Parts of America (MPAA +12.1%) jumps double-digits after saying two of its separately...

    Motorcar Parts of America (MPAA +12.1%) jumps double-digits after saying two of its separately capitalized subsidiaries will file for bankruptcy, resulting in their deconsolidation from MPAA's financial statements. CEO Selwyn Joffe says the company's rotating electrical base business is still strong and should turn in record revenue of $213M when the company reports full year results this month. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • TGE

    Tallgrass Energy Partners (TEP +0.8%) hovers in the green after Deutsche initiated coverage -...

    Tallgrass Energy Partners (TEP +0.8%) hovers in the green after Deutsche initiated coverage - along with a host of other firms - on the shares with a Hold rating and a $24 price target. Deutsche says TEP is essentially a mid-continent and Rockies region natural gas, NGLs and oil pipeline MLP, and is well positioned to capture the infrastructure growth in these regions.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • KS

    KapStone Paper & Packaging (KS +9.4%) trades higher after the company announces it will...

    KapStone Paper & Packaging (KS +9.4%) trades higher after the company announces it will acquire Longstone Fiber for $1.025B. The deal is expected to close this summer and will be subject to particular post-closing adjustments.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • ETR

    Entergy (ETR +2%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold to Buy with a $74 price target (from $66) at...

    Entergy (ETR +2%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold to Buy with a $74 price target (from $66) at Deutsche Bank, which sees added value from the proposal for ETR to separate and merge its electric transmission business into ITC Holdings. While the firm sees upside if the ITC deal closes, ETR also should sport “decent total return” at current levels on a standalone basis.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • AMBI

    Ambit Biosciences (AMBI +1.3%) moves up on a number of upbeat initiations by the Street as it...

    Ambit Biosciences (AMBI +1.3%) moves up on a number of upbeat initiations by the Street as it comes out of its quiet period. Baird, BMO and Leerink all start the shares with an Outperform, while Citigroup initiates coverage with a Buy. Notably, Leerink's Howard Liang says that it sees AMBI's quizartinib as the best-in-class FLT3 inhibitor, which currently represents the mainstay for targeted therapy for acute myeloid leukemia.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • AMAG

    AMAG Pharmaceuticals (AMAG +2.2%) inks a licensing deal with Access Pharmaceuticals related to...

    AMAG Pharmaceuticals (AMAG +2.2%) inks a licensing deal with Access Pharmaceuticals related to the commercialization of MuGard. a mucoadhesive that is designed to manage oral mucositis, in the US and its territories. Under the agreement, Access will receive an upfront licensing fee of $3.3M and a tiered, double digit royalty on net sales in the licensed territories. AMAG will also purchase existing MuGard inventory from Access.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • ARP

    Atlas Resources Partners (ARP -4.2%) and Atlas Energy (OTC:ATLS +8%) move in different...

    Atlas Resources Partners (ARP -4.2%) and Atlas Energy (OTC:ATLS +8%) move in different directions after ARP's $733M purchase of 466B cu. ft. of proven natural gas reserves from EP Energy. ARP is paying for the deal via a 12M share public offering. ATLS, while buying a smaller share of reserves from EP, also offered FY 2014 guidance that was more than double the most-recent annualized distribution.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 2 Comments
  • SGOC

    Midday top 10 gainers: SGOC +25%. ACAD +17%. STEL +17%. MPAA +14%. TRMD-OLD +9%. OVAS-OLD +13%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: SGOC +25%. ACAD +17%. STEL +17%. MPAA +14%. TRMD-OLD +9%. OVAS-OLD +13%. CLIR +13%. TPLM +12%. RVLT +13%. KNDI +12%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: DVAX -35%. OSH -18%. OTC:ECTE -16%. OTC:AFFY -14%. AEPI -14%. OMX -12%. SHI -12%. PLM -11%. GNRC -11%. CBAK-OLD -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • MTL

    Mechel OAO (MTL +7.6%) says it's signed an agreement with BelAZ OAO to create a joint...

    Mechel OAO (MTL +7.6%) says it's signed an agreement with BelAZ OAO to create a joint Russo-Belarusian venture called ElgaBelAvto OAO, to provide maintenance and repairs of BelAZ mining dump trucks in the Republic of Sakha. The joint venture is expected to fully meet the maintenance needs of Yakutugol Holding Company's two largest coal open pits, Neryungrinsky and Elga, which include over 140 mining truck units in the medium run. Investment in the project is estimated around $9.5M through, and is slated to begin in late 2013, early 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • QRVO

    More on Charter's upgrade of RF Micro (RFMD +4.5%): Analyst Ed Snyder expects RF Micro to score...

    More on Charter's upgrade of RF Micro (RFMD +4.5%): Analyst Ed Snyder expects RF Micro to score a power amplifier design win for the iPhone 5S. He thinks the value of the company's company's iPhone content will rise 70% if it only supplies a power amplifier for the 5S, and 160% if it also maintains the antenna tuner slot it has for the iPhone 5. DA Davidson reported of a possible iPhone power amplifier win when upgrading RF Micro on May 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • KTOS

    Kratos Defense & Social Security Solutions (KTOS +2.6%) moves up after announcing that it's...

    Kratos Defense & Social Security Solutions (KTOS +2.6%) moves up after announcing that it's landed new contract awards totaling around $3M for specialized products and equipment in support of certain modular data center and communications related programs to an unspecified customer. Due to the classified nature of the products it will be delivering, no further details are provided. The award comes just days after the company announced it had inked a $4M contract for 'specialized equipment' in support of certain radar related and other classified National Security programs.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum (SPRD +3.4%) rallies after SA Pro contributor Ashraf Eassa argues the Chinese...

    Spreadtrum (SPRD +3.4%) rallies after SA Pro contributor Ashraf Eassa argues the Chinese baseband chipmaker will benefit from surging low-end smartphone demand. Among his points: Spreadtrum's entry into the W-CDMA 3G baseband space greatly increases its addressable market; a mix shift towards chips with 3G/4G connectivity and more processing power will lead to higher ASPs; and sales of TD-SCDMA 3G chips (used in phones on China Mobile's 3G network) will grow rapidly even if some share is lost (Qualcomm and MediaTek are ramping their efforts here).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • FDML

    Shares of Federal-Mogul (FDML +8.1%) pop today after it guides both Q2 and FY13 revenue above...

    Shares of Federal-Mogul (FDML +8.1%) pop today after it guides both Q2 and FY13 revenue above Street estimates. The company says its expects Q2 sales to come in around $1.7B - $1.8B, compared with the consensus estimate of $1.7B, while for FY13, it raises its sales guidance to $6.8B - $7B, above analysts expectations of $6.7B.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • TECK

    Teck Resources (TCK -2.3%) is downgraded to Neutral from Outperform with a price target of...

    Teck Resources (TCK -2.3%) is downgraded to Neutral from Outperform with a price target of $31.40 (from $34.42) at Macquarie, which points to uncertainty in met coal and copper markets over the next few months. Also, TCK announced Friday an exchange of certain oil-sands leases related to its Frontier oil-sands project.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 3 Comments
  • BLRX

    BioLineRx (BLRX +4.2%) says it's signed an out-licensing agreement with Jiangsu Chia-tai...

    BioLineRx (BLRX +4.2%) says it's signed an out-licensing agreement with Jiangsu Chia-tai Tianqing Pharmaceutical for the development and commercialization of BL-8030, an oral treatment for Hepatitis C. The agreement gives the Chinese biotech exclusive rights to develop, manufacture and commercialize BL-8030 in China and Hong Kong. Jiangsu will pay an upfront license fee plus future milestone payments, giving the deal a potential value of around $30M.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • LDK

    Recession-hit Spain is set to be the latest European country to slash solar subsidies: sources...

    Recession-hit Spain is set to be the latest European country to slash solar subsidies: sources tell the WSJ the government will announce 10%-20% cuts as soon as June 21. Europe's share of global solar installations has already been rapidly declining, thanks to macro issues and subsidy cuts in Germany (Europe's largest market). Solar shares are rallying in spite of the news (TAN +3.2%). LDK +7.6%. SOL +8.1%. SPWR +4.7%.  YGE +5.3%. SUNE +3.9% in spite of getting started at Equalweight by Morgan Stanley. SolarCity (SCTY +5.8%) is up ahead of tomorrow's lockup expiration, after getting hammered last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM | 4 Comments
  • UEC

    Uranium Energy (UEC +4.3%) shares are strong after reporting a loss of $0.05/share in its April...

    Uranium Energy (UEC +4.3%) shares are strong after reporting a loss of $0.05/share in its April quarter vs. a $0.10 loss in the year-ago period, on revenue of $2.8M resulting from the sale of 70K lbs. of U3O8 at an average sales price of $40/lb. Production from UEC's Palangana Mine increased to 69K lbs. of U3O8 vs. to 48K lbs. in the prior quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 2 Comments
  • KMG

    KMG Chemicals (KMG +1.6%) trades up after its bottom line FQ3 number beat Street estimates...

    KMG Chemicals (KMG +1.6%) trades up after its bottom line FQ3 number beat Street estimates earlier. Revenue missed however, as total sales decline by 10% Y/Y. Looking forward though, the companys expects its EPS to improve slightly in FQ4, citing around $1M in closing and integration costs which it anticipates recognizing for the improvement.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • TWI

    Titan International (TWI -8.2%) adds to Friday's losses, bringing the two-day sell-off to ~14%....

    Titan International (TWI -8.2%) adds to Friday's losses, bringing the two-day sell-off to ~14%. Jefferies downgrades the shares to Hold from Buy and cuts its FY13 EPS estimate to $1.75 from $2 citing comments from CEO Maurice Taylor last week regarding destocking. Not to be outdone, Feltl (Hold from Buy), William Blair (Market Perform from Outperform), and Janney Montgomery (Neutral from Buy) all cut their ratings on the shares as well.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • IBIO

    iBio (IBIO +18%) says that one of its antibody patents for treating anthrax has been allowed in...

    iBio (IBIO +18%) says that one of its antibody patents for treating anthrax has been allowed in China. The patent covers a human monoclonal antibody specifically recognizing the cell binding protein known as protective antigen of Bacillus anthracis, the bacteria causing anthrax. The antibody, produced with the use of IBIO's iBioLaunch platform technology, prevented death in 100% of animals given an otherwise lethal doses of anthrax spores.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • CSPI

    CSP Inc. (CSPI +8.6%) rises sharply in early trading. In an article still under embargo, SA Pro...

    CSP Inc. (CSPI +8.6%) rises sharply in early trading. In an article still under embargo, SA Pro contributor Nick Ghattas calls the company "a cheap, cash-rich micro cap" and says catalysts including a contract with defense contractor Lockheed Martin could drive gains going forward.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • FPP

    FieldPoint Petroleum (FPP -3.8%) says its founder, President and CEO Ray Reaves has died in an...

    FieldPoint Petroleum (FPP -3.8%) says its founder, President and CEO Ray Reaves has died in an auto accident. Longtime board member Roger Bryant will serve as Chairman, fully authorized with executive powers necessary to conduct all aspects of the business, while a search for a new CEO is initiated.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • CECO

    Education stocks (CECO, STRA, APEI, LINC, DV) are ripping higher again, led by Apollo Group...

    Education stocks (CECO, STRA, APEI, LINC, DV) are ripping higher again, led by Apollo Group (APOL +5.9%) and Corinithian Colleges (COCO +6.8%). Traders are buzzing about technical indicators in the sector, but SA contributor David Waldron is looking down the road to see a "shakeout" in the education market that could lead to a resumption of consistent growth and profits even with regulation higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • BGS

    Shares of B&G Foods (BGS +7.1%) trade higher after the announcement the company bought...

    Shares of B&G Foods (BGS +7.1%) trade higher after the announcement the company bought Robert's American Gourmet Foods and will add to its stable of brands.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • ECTE

    Echo Therapeutics (OTC:ECTE -16%) trades lower this morning, coming off Friday's first day of...

    Echo Therapeutics (OTC:ECTE -16%) trades lower this morning, coming off Friday's first day of trading following a 1-for-10 reverse split. Although there's no stand-alone driver for today's decline, the company did announce that it's submitted a pre-submission package to the FDA for using its Symphony CGM System in the hospital critical care environment. Additionally, the company has also requested a meeting with the agency to develop a clinical and regulatory plan to support the approval of the system.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • XONE

    ExOne (XONE +4.1%) leads a rally in 3D printer makers following a weekend report Stratasys is in...

    ExOne (XONE +4.1%) leads a rally in 3D printer makers following a weekend report Stratasys is in talks to buy growing enthusiast-focused printer vendor Makerbot; Stratasys (SSYS +2%) and 3D Systems (DDD +2.5%) are also higher. As the smallest of the three firms, ExOne (focused on industrial clients rather than enthusiasts) is seen as the most likely M&A target.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • FB

    Stifel's Jordan Rohan upgrades Facebook (FB +4.1%) to Buy, sending shares back above $24. Rohan...

    Stifel's Jordan Rohan upgrades Facebook (FB +4.1%) to Buy, sending shares back above $24. Rohan sees potential upside to Q2 PC ad sales, and considers it a matter of time before Facebook joins the S&P 500. "When the company reports in late July, many investors will be embracing back-to-school and holiday trades, of which Facebook is one of the best." Stifel cut Facebook to Hold on Jan. 31, when shares were at $31.24.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 2 Comments
  • NFLX

    An ITC administrative law judge rules Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) and Roku don't infringe a Rovi (ROVI...

B. Riley has cut Rovi to Neutral, stating it's "now somewhat less optimistic about Rovi’s chances of prevailing." The firm thinks deals with Netflix and Roku could respectively yield $90M/year and $10M-$20M/year in licensing fees over the next 3-5 years.
